item.title: Ellison's Cave is a pit cave located in Georgia. It's the 12th deepest cave in the U.S. and features the deepest, unobstructed underground pit in the continental U.S. named Fantastic Pit. The cave is over 12 miles long and extends 1063 feet vertically https://t.co/S0NPdkCIAf https://t.co/SWvkkgURhP

item.title: What triggers anorexia nervosa? We find that chronic stress can trigger willful seeking of a starvation-like state in mice. As in humans, this was enriched in female mice, particularly those predisposed to stress. https://t.co/ZctjCgwQYD 1/7 https://t.co/6TPYouEmoc
item.description: What triggers anorexia nervosa? We find that chronic stress can trigger willful seeking of a starvation-like state in mice. As in humans, this was enriched in female mice, particularly those predisposed to stress. https://t.co/ZctjCgwQYD 1/7 https://t.co/6TPYouEmoc
item.content:encoded: What triggers anorexia nervosa? We find that chronic stress can trigger willful seeking of a starvation-like state in mice. As in humans, this was enriched in female mice, particularly those predisposed to stress. https://t.co/ZctjCgwQYD 1/7 https://t.co/6TPYouEmoc

item.title: Elevated anxiety often precedes anorexia nervosa. Patients with anorexia nervosa often describe hunger as pleasant, potentially because food restriction can be anxiolytic. We tested whether chronic stress can cause animals to prefer a starvation-like state. 2/7

item.title: We developed a virtual reality place preference paradigm in which head-fixed mice can voluntarily seek a starvation-like state induced by optogenetic stimulation of hypothalamic agouti-related peptide (AgRP) neurons. 3/7

item.title: Prior to stress induction, male but not female mice showed mild aversion to AgRP stimulation. Strikingly, following chronic stress, a subset of females developed a strong preference for AgRP stimulation that was predicted by high baseline anxiety. 4/7 https://t.co/8H4z79IMnB

item.title: @KordingLab @blamlab Indeed, hazard ratio decreases from 30 to 2.3 when adjusting for confounds. I don't have THAT much trust in statistical models. Re trend, how could the proportion attributable to cannabis use disorder grow so much (4 fold since 1990) if the hazard ratio itself does not grow?
item.description: @KordingLab @blamlab Indeed, hazard ratio decreases from 30 to 2.3 when adjusting for confounds. I don't have THAT much trust in statistical models. Re trend, how could the proportion attributable to cannabis use disorder grow so much (4 fold since 1990) if the hazard ratio itself does not grow?
item.content:encoded: @KordingLab @blamlab Indeed, hazard ratio decreases from 30 to 2.3 when adjusting for confounds. I don't have THAT much trust in statistical models. Re trend, how could the proportion attributable to cannabis use disorder grow so much (4 fold since 1990) if the hazard ratio itself does not grow?

item.title:
@KordingLab @blamlab I actually buy the causal link... based on personal anecdotal experience.
But, based on that same anecdotal data, I think it is almost surely the case that cannabis only accelerates and exacerbates the situation for those who are already at risk for schizophrenia anyway.

item.title: Elucidating the brain‚Äôs structure-function organization is key to understanding perception. A classic example are cortical columns, a vertical organization of neurons w/ similar function. They exist in primary sensory areas but it‚Äôs unclear if they are present throughout cortex
item.description: Elucidating the brain‚Äôs structure-function organization is key to understanding perception. A classic example are cortical columns, a vertical organization of neurons w/ similar function. They exist in primary sensory areas but it‚Äôs unclear if they are present throughout cortex
item.content:encoded: Elucidating the brain‚Äôs structure-function organization is key to understanding perception. A classic example are cortical columns, a vertical organization of neurons w/ similar function. They exist in primary sensory areas but it‚Äôs unclear if they are present throughout cortex

item.title: Here, we asked whether area V4, a mid-level area of the macaque visual system, is organized into functional columns. We presented grayscale natural images & recorded responses of >1200 single V4 neurons in 100 electrophysiological recording sessions using 32-channel depth probes https://t.co/JGjN7K5AFE
item.description: Here, we asked whether area V4, a mid-level area of the macaque visual system, is organized into functional columns. We presented grayscale natural images & recorded responses of >1200 single V4 neurons in 100 electrophysiological recording sessions using 32-channel depth probes https://t.co/JGjN7K5AFE

We presented grayscale natural images & recorded responses of >1200 single V4 neurons in 100 electrophysiological recording sessions using 32-channel depth probes https://t.co/JGjN7K5AFE

item.title: We fitted the readout of a pre-trained robust ResNet50 on our V4 data to predict neuronal firing rates to natural images, achieving high performance. We treated this model as a ‚Äúdigital twin‚Äù of macaque V4 and used it for vast in silico experimentation https://t.co/0JgczU8kW3
item.description: We fitted the readout of a pre-trained robust ResNet50 on our V4 data to predict neuronal firing rates to natural images, achieving high performance. We treated this model as a ‚Äúdigital twin‚Äù of macaque V4 and used it for vast in silico experimentation https://t.co/0JgczU8kW3

We treated this model as a ‚Äúdigital twin‚Äù of macaque V4 and used it for vast in silico experimentation https://t.co/0JgczU8kW3

item.title: We used our model to generate ‚ÄúMaximally Exciting Images‚Äù (MEIs) for each neuron. These MEIs exhibited complex features like textures, shapes, or even high-level attributes such as eye-like structures in line w/ tuning properties of V4 neurons identified using parametric stimuli https://t.co/nqmDLDkgtb

item.title: We verified our MEIs in vivo by developing a closed-loop paradigm for acute electrophysiological recordings of single neurons. The MEI of a single neuron consistently elicited higher neuronal responses than control natural images, suggesting it is indeed the optimal stimulus https://t.co/246tbzluLR
item.description: We verified our MEIs in vivo by developing a closed-loop paradigm for acute electrophysiological recordings of single neurons. item.content:encoded: We verified our MEIs in vivo by developing a closed-loop paradigm for acute electrophysiological recordings of single neurons. The MEI of a single neuron consistently elicited higher neuronal responses than control natural images, suggesting it is indeed the optimal stimulus https://t.co/246tbzluLR

item.title: We noticed that MEIs from single sessions were more similar to each other than to MEIs from other sessions & quantified this using psychophysics. As neurons from one session are arranged orthogonal to the surface, this suggests that V4 tuning may be organized in a columnar manner https://t.co/Im4FGbHdxa

item.title: We employed a contrastive learning method to further quantify MEI similarity within and across recording sessions & found that the mean distance between MEIs in the embedding space was significantly smaller within a session than across sessions https://t.co/s9fWyEuFmA
